info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued July 18 at 2:24PM EDT until July 18 at 3:00PM EDT by NWS Philadelphia - Mount Holly
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 300 PM EDT FOR SOUTHWESTERN CHESTER COUNTY... At 224 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located over Glen Roy, or 16 miles northwest of Newark, moving east at 20 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts and quarter size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Minor damage to vehicles is possible. Wind damage to roofs, siding, trees, and power lines is possible. Locations impacted include... Kennett Square, Oxford, West Grove, Glen Roy, Mount Vernon, Kemblesville, Landenberg, North Star, Avondale and Toughkenamon. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.00 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building.
